@TribalWater: Indigenous Open Data Summit, indigenous data sovereignty is protecting the sacred #DataWarriors #IODC16pic.twitter.com/qqnn2Go7cJ
@od4_d: Don't miss the #Indigenous #OpenData Summit about to kick off! Check out the agenda here: http://ow.ly/23ho304R5b7  #IODC16

info: The event was organized by Stephanie Carroll Rainie from the University of Arizona (USA - Ahtna Athabascan), and with the participation of many people coming from all continents.

session.description: The Indigenous Open Data Summit provided a forum and space for advancing discussion about and action on Indigenous data within the open data movement

conference_notes:
• Proactivity is key to make people and organizations realize the power and impact of open data
  • Open Data Charter is more than a group of principles but an organization than can help open data to get to next level
  • Challenges and gaps on open data situation must be solved using the tools and solutions we’ve seen working on other countries or areas, but also using the human resources that will make a change
  • A political commitment is key to develop open data strategies
name: Indigenous Open Data Summit
